thread.title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Hughes has huge game in Richmond Hill win
thread.title_full: HIGH SCHOOLS: Hughes has huge game in Richmond Hill win | savannahnow.com

author: Savannah Morning News
title: HIGH SCHOOLS: Hughes has huge game in Richmond Hill win
text:
Photos Back | Next Jamie Parker/Bryan County Now Statesboro running back Tupac Lanier tires to evade Wildcat defender Brandon Armstrong (25) while ahead of the play another Blue Devil blocks against RHHS's Ronald Fuselier (6). Back | Next Jamie Parker/Bryan County Now Wildcat Aaron Bedgood's big hit jarred the ball away from Statesboro punt returmer Samad Foster. The referees however flagged Bedgood for an early hit. Back | Next Jamie Parker/Bryan County Now
Richmond Hill’s Brian Hughes (12) runs with the ball against Statesboro on Thursday night at Richmond Hill.
SPECIAL Savannah Morning News Richmond Hill rolled to a 39-14 win over visiting Statesboro on Thursday night in a Region 3- football matchup. Junior quarterback Brian Hughes rushed for 195 yards and five touchdowns on 17 carries to lead the Wildcats, and completed 7 of 16 passes for 137 yards.
Sophomore receiver Sam James had four receptions for 83 yards for the Wildcats, who improved to 3-3 overall and 2-3 in region play. Richmond Hill next plays at South Effingham on Oct. 16.
“We blocked and tackled on the perimeter as good as we have all year. Execution is the big thing,” Wildcats coach Matt LeZotte told Bryan County Now correspondent Steve Scholar.
Richmond Hill 11 7 21 0 - 39
Statesboro 7 0 0 7 - 14
SOFTBALL
RICHMOND HILL 1,
WARE COUNTY 0
DOUGLAS — Richmond Hill didn’t score until the top of the seventh inning in the Region 3- championship game at Coffee County High School, but Madelyn Gorsuch’s solo homer was all the Wildcats needed. Senior pitcher Sammi Mault shut down the Ware County bats in the bottom half of the inning, as she had all game, and the Wildcats came away with a 1-0 win and the region title.
Richmond Hill will host a team to be determined in the first round of the Class state tournament Wednesday.
SOUTH EFFINGHAM 6,
COFFEE 5
DOUGLAS — With the help of four Coffee errors, South Effingham rallied to a win in the third-place game of the Region 3- tournament. The Mustangs claimed the No. 3 seed in the Class state playoffs, with the Trojans settling for the fourth and final seed.
Coffee looked to take control when they took a 5-0 lead in the top of the fifth. After the Mustangs got their first run on the board in the bottom of the seventh, they stormed back to tie the game in a four-run eighth inning, then plated the game-winning run in the ninth.
CHS 010 040 00 — 5 8 4
SEHS 000 001 41 — 6 8 1
W—Bri Lawson. L—Sheala Brown. Leading hitters—CHS, Tess Robinson 2 hits; Chain Watson 2 hits, RBI; Ashlee Durrance H, 2 RBI; Katie Lott H, RBI; Hollyn Lott H, RBI. SEHS, Katelynn Hodges 2 H, RBI; Cason Smith 2 H; Alexa Johanson 2 Hs, Mallori Jenkins, H, RBI
Region 3-A tourney
ALAMO — Calvary Day won two of three games, dropping a 4-3 decision in the Region 3-A tournament finals against Emanuel County Institute at Wheeler County High. The Cavaliers, No. 8 in the most recent GHSA Class A Private School softball rankings, start in the playoffs on Oct. 21.
Senior Jessica Ginn had a stellar day in the pitching circle, winning a pair of games including a no-hitter against Johnson Co., where she struck out eight batters and hit one. Kelcey Black was 5 for 9 with three RBIs in the three games.
ECI 4, CALVARY DAY 3
